IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: PROVIDING PRIMARY HEALTHCARE SERVICES FROM BEGINNING TO END IN ORDER TO IMPROVE LIVES THROUGH COMMUNITY HEALTH SERVICES.
IRS990.MissionDesc: PROVIDING PRIMARY HEALTHCARE SERVICES FROM BEGINNING TO END IN ORDER TO IMPROVE LIVES THROUGH COMMUNITY HEALTH SERVICES.
IRS990.Desc: PRIMARY HEALTHCARE SERVICES ARE PROVIDED TO THE RESIDENTS OF HAMILTON AND CLAY COUNTIES IN RURAL NEBRASKA.

SupplementalInformationGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FACILITY 1, MEMORIAL COMMUNITY HEALTH, INC. - PART V, LINE 3E
SupplementalInformationGrp.ExplanationTxt: THE COMMUNITY HEALTH NEEDS AND PRIORITIES INCLUDE ACCIDENTAL DEATH, AGING POPULATION, BIRTHS TO TEEN MOTHERS, BEHAVIORAL HEALTH, AND OBESITY.

SupplementalInformationGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FACILITY 1, MEMORIAL COMMUNITY HEALTH, INC. - PART V, LINE 5
SupplementalInformationGrp.ExplanationTxt: COMMUNITY FOCUS GROUPS WERE HELD WITH ASSISTANCE FROM THE CENTRAL DISTRICT HEALTH DEPARTMENT.

SupplementalInformationGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FACILITY 1, MEMORIAL COMMUNITY HEALTH, INC. - PART V, LINE 6A
SupplementalInformationGrp.ExplanationTxt: OTHER HOSPITALS INVOLVED IN THE NEEDS ASSESSMENT INCLUDED CHI ST. FRANCIS IN GRAND ISLAND, NE AND MERRICK MEDICAL CENTER IN CENTRAL CITY, NE.

SupplementalInformationGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FACILITY 1, MEMORIAL COMMUNITY HEALTH, INC. - PART V, LINE 11
SupplementalInformationGrp.ExplanationTxt: OBESITY AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH WERE THE TWO AREAS MCHI ELECTED TO WORK ON AS THEY HAVE THE BIGGEST IMPACT ON MANY OTHER AREAS OF HEALTH AND WELL BEING IN THE COMMUNITY AND WERE THE AREAS THAT COULD BE ADDRESSED WITH THE HOSPITAL'S RESOURCES. THE AREAS THAT WERE NOT ADDRESSED WERE ACCIDENTAL DEATH, AGING POPULATION, AND BIRTH TO TEEN MOTHERS. WITH LIMITED FINANCIAL AND PERSONNEL RESOURCES, MCHI WOULD HAVE MINIMAL IMPACT ON THESE AREAS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: PART III, LINE 2 - BAD DEBT EXPENSE METHODOLOGY
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BAD DEBT FOOTNOTE DISCLOSURE QUOTED FROM FINANCIAL STATEMENTS: ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE ARE REDUCED BY AN ALLOWANCE FOR DOUBTFUL ACCOUNTS. IN EVALUATING THE COLLECTABILITY OF ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE, THE HOSPITAL ANALYZES ITS PAST HISTORY AND IDENTIFIES TRENDS FOR EACH OF ITS MAJOR PAYOR SOURCES OF REVENUE TO ESTIMATE THE APPROPRIATE ALLOWANCE FOR DOUBTFUL ACCOUNTS AND PROVISION FOR BAD DEBTS. MANAGEMENT REGULARLY REVIEWS DATA ABOUT THESE MAJOR PAYOR SOURCES OF REVENUE IN EVALUATING THE SUFFICIENCY OF THE ALLOWANCE FOR DOUBTFUL ACCOUNTS. FOR RECEIVABLES ASSOCIATED WITH SERVICES PROVIDED TO PATIENTS WHO HAVE THIRD-PARTY COVERAGE, THE HOSPITAL ANALYZES CONTRACTUALLY DUE AMOUNTS AND PROVIDES AN ALLOWANCE FOR DOUBTFUL ACCOUNTS AND A PROVISION FOR BAD DEBTS, IF NECESSARY (FOR EXAMPLE, FOR EXPECTED UNCOLLECTIBLE DEDUCTIBLES AND COPAYMENTS ON ACCOUNTS FOR WHICH THE THIRD-PARTY PAYOR HAS NOT YET PAID, OR FOR PAYORS WHO ARE KNOWN TO BE HAVING FINANCIAL DIFFICULTIES THAT MAKE THE REALIZATION OF AMOUNTS DUE UNLIKELY). FOR RECEIVABLES ASSOCIATED WITH UNINSURED/SELF-PAY PATIENTS WHICH INCLUDES BOTH PATIENTS WITHOUT INSURANCE AND PATIENTS WITH DEDUCTIBLE AND COPAYMENT BALANCES DUE FOR WHICH THIRD-PARTY COVERAGE EXIST FOR PART OF THE BILL), THE HOSPITAL RECORDS A SIGNIFICANT PROVISION FOR BAD DEBTS IN THE PERIOD OF SERVICE ON THE BASIS OF ITS PAST EXPERIENCE, WHICH INDICATES THAT MANY PATIENTS ARE UNABLE OR UNWILLING TO PAY THE PORTION OF THEIR BILL FOR WHICH THEY ARE FINANCIALLY RESPONSIBLE. COSTING METHODOLOGY FOR LINE 2 IS ACTUAL REVENUE WRITTEN OFF AND SENT TO COLLECTION MULTIPLIED BY THE MEDICARE COST/CHARGE RATIO FROM 9/30/18 FILED COST REPORT. COSTING METHODOLOGY FOR LINE 3 IS ESTIMATED USING KNOWLEDGE OF DEMOGRAPHICS OF THOSE SENT TO COLLECTIONS. BAD DEBTS SHOULD BE CONSIDERED AS COMMUNITY BENEFIT BECAUSE QUALITY HEALTHCARE WAS GIVEN TO THOSE PATIENTS. OTHER AGENCIES DO NOT HAVE TO SUBSIDIZE THESE PATIENTS MEDICAL CARE.

MEDICARE SHORTFALL SHOULD BE TREATED AS COMMUNITY BENEFIT BECAUSE NOBODY ELSE SUBSIDIZES THE SHORTFALLS AND THE CARE GIVEN ULTIMATELY IMPROVES THE LIVES OF THOSE SERVED. THE MEDICARE COST REPORT AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS WERE USED TO DETERMINE THE AMOUNTS REPORTED ON LINE 6.

MEMORIAL COMMUNITY HEALTH PERIODICALLY ASSESSES THE COMMUNITY TO SEEK THEIR HEALTH CARE NEEDS. EMPLOYEES ALSO ACT AS REFERENCES FOR THE COMMUNITIES NEEDS VIA THE SUGGESTIONS AND COMMENTS HEARD FROM PATIENTS REGARDING NEEDS AND WANTS IN THE COMMUNITIES HEALTH CARE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: PART VI, LINE 3 - PATIENT EDUCATION OF ELIGIBILITY FOR ASSISTANCE
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MEMORIAL COMMUNITY HEALTH INFORMS PATIENTS OF THE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM THRU THE FACE SHEET WHERE IT IDENTIFIES THE PROGRAM TO PATIENTS. THE FINANCIAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM IS ALSO MADE KNOWN VIA THE ORGANIZATION'S WEBSITE. ANY PATIENT WHO INQUIRES ABOUT THE POLICY OR SUGGESTS THAT THEY ARE HAVING DIFFICULTY MAKING PAYMENTS IS OFFERED THE CHARITY CARE PROGRAM BY OUR COLLECTORS. UPON IDENTIFICATION OF NEED, AN APPLICATION IS MAILED TO THE PATIENT AND EVALUATED UPON RETURN.

MEMORIAL COMMUNITY HEALTH SERVES A RURAL POPULATION WITH AVERAGE TO HIGHER THAN AVERAGE INCOME LEVELS. THE MEDICAID AND INDIGENT POPULATION IS LOWER THAN AVERAGE. MCHI HAS A LOW PERCENTAGE OF UNINSURED PATIENTS AS WELL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: PART VI, LINE 5 - PROMOTION OF COMMUNITY HEALTH
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL OF THE ORGANIZATION'S GOVERNING BODY IS COMPRISED OF PERSONS WHO RESIDE IN THE ORGANIZATION'S PRIMARY SERVICE AREA AND ARE NEITHER EMPLOYEES NOR CONTRACTORS OF THE ORGANIZATION, NOR FAMILY MEMBERS THEREOF. THE ORGANIZATION DOES EXTEND MEDICAL STAFF PRIVELEDGES TO ALL QUALIFIED PHYSICIANS IN ITS COMMUNITY FOR SOME OR ALL OF ITS DEPARTMENTS. MCHI ALSO PROVIDES NUMEROUS EDUCATIONAL AND COMMUNITY ORIENTED PROGRAMS TO ASSIST THE COMMUNITY WITH ALL OF ITS HEALTH CARE NEEDS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE J, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 5A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FOR PHYSICIAN PRODUCTION WORK RVUS PERFORMED DURING THE CONTRACT YEAR IN EXCESS OF 2128, PHYSICIAN SHALL BE COMPENSATED AT THE RATE OF 43 PER WORK RVU.
FOR BONUS/INCENTIVE COMPENSATION LISTED PER PART II, PHYSICIAN COMPENSATION INCENTIVE BONUS DETERMINED BASED UPON PRODUCTION USING A CLINIC RVU METHODOLOGY - SEE PART 1, LINE 5A.
THE GOVERNING BOARD OF DIRECTORS HAS DESIGNATED AND AUTHORIZED THE FACILITY'S CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER TO REVIEW AND APPROVE THE FEDERAL FORM 990 ON BEHALF OF THE GOVERNING BOARD OF DIRECTORS.
IF A CONFLICT OF INTEREST WAS TO ARISE, THAT MEMBER REFRAINS FROM PARTICIPATION IN THE DECISION INVOLVING THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST.
THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD REVIEWS THE CEO'S PERFORMANCE AND REGULATES THE COMPENSATION OF THE CEO. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE APPROVES ANY COMPENSATION INCREASE EACH YEAR.
ALL KEY EMPLOYEES HAVE A YEARLY REVIEW BY THE CEO THAT INCLUDES PERFORMANCE MEASURES AND DISCUSSION OF THE PRIOR YEAR GOALS AND HOW THEY WERE MET OR NOT.
NO DOCUMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC
